<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

<item>
 <title>Live Report: Wild Beasts - Eventim Apollo, London</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/live/live-report-wild-beasts-eventim-apollo-london</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Wild%20Beasts%20-%20Boy%20King%20-%20P.C%20Tom%20Andrew%20-%20%20S05_155%20-%2072%20dpi_0_1.jpg?itok=Mn08qtik"><a href="/live/live-report-wild-beasts-eventim-apollo-london"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Wild%20Beasts%20-%20Boy%20King%20-%20P.C%20Tom%20Andrew%20-%20%20S05_155%20-%2072%20dpi_0_1.jpg?itok=Mn08qtik" width="628" height="419" alt="Wild Beasts (Credit: Tom Andrew)" title="Wild Beasts (Credit: Tom Andrew)" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Last orders from a dearly loved group...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>In some ways a band’s final steps are even more important than their first. LCD Soundsystem solidified their legacy with a titanic Madison Square Gardens show, The Band signed off with The Last Waltz, each helping to codify their catalogue with one final creative stamp.</p>
<p><strong>Wild Beasts</strong> have always been one of British music’s more articulate, sensual experiences, so the Kendal group were never going to say farewell on a desultory, ambiguous, or unfulfilling note. Agreeing to call time on their years together after five albums of terrific music, the band have released one final EP and completed a small string of magical UK shows.</p>
<p>And it’s come to this. Performing without support, Wild Beasts welcome thousands of fans from across the country and beyond to Hammersmith Apollo for one final show, one final night – and it’s a soaring, peerless triumph.</p>
<p>Drawing on the full force of their catalogue, Wild Beasts seem able to express both the progression and creative unity that has propelled their work, dipping into debut album ‘Limbo Panto’ - “God knows why they gave that budget to a band like us,” Tom Fleming tells the crowd – while rushing all the way through to 2016’s ‘Boy King’.</p>
<p>It’s noticeable, too, just how much of a <em>band</em>, a collective Wild Beasts truly are. Drummer Chris Talbot’s insistent pulse underpins the set, while Hayden Thorpe’s other-worldly operatics are shadowed by Tom Fleming’s low lustre. Split into three parts, the demise of Wild Beasts are first seems surreal, difficult to comprehend.</p>
<p>Yet as the perfectly aligned 23 song performance rushes ahead, the mood shifts – through defiance, anger, and finally acceptance. As ‘End Come Too Soon’ collapses into a wall of feedback driven noise Wild Beasts embrace onstage, four friends gathered in a huddle, the weight of ten years pulsing out over the speakers.</p>
<p>It’s a strikingly moving scene – some of the band look visibly shaken, while members of the audience are openly weeping. As emotional – and enormously fulfilling – as this finale is, however, Wild Beasts have one last twist.</p>
<p>A choir is assembled, performing an a capella version of ‘Cheerio Chaps, Cheerio Goodbye’ while the band recover backstage. It’s a wry, impish move, whose message is clear: the songs live on, even though the group themselves have departed. With the lights going up and tears drying, it’s an exhaustive run through one of British music’s singular catalogues.</p>
<p>Where they go next – solo projects are mooted, through some may remove themselves from the limelight – is up to them, but the loss of Wild Beasts is something that will be felt keenly with each passing day. As Hayden Thorpe sang: “All we want is to feel that feeling again...”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 15:12:06 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Robin Murray</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">99873 at http://www.clashmusic.com</guid>
 <comments>http://www.clashmusic.com/live/live-report-wild-beasts-eventim-apollo-london#comments</comments>
</item>
<item>
 <title>Morrissey Has Ruffled Some Scottish Feathers</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/live/morrissey-has-ruffled-some-scottish-feathers</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Mozza_0_1_2_3.jpg?itok=wHpAcuMm"><a href="/live/morrissey-has-ruffled-some-scottish-feathers"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Mozza_0_1_2_3.jpg?itok=wHpAcuMm" width="608" height="456" alt="Morrissey" title="Morrissey" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">With a few jibes about Nicola Sturgeon and Alex Salmond...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Morrissey</strong> seems to be ruffling a few feathers on the Scottish leg of his nationwide tour.</p>
<p>The outspoken singer played Aberdeen on Friday night (February 16th) and took a poke at former SNP leader Alex Salmond.</p>
<p>Not quite content with this, Morrissey again broached Scottish politics during his show at Glasgow's SSE Hydro venue.</p>
<p>Asking the crowd "Does anyone in here actually like Nicola Sturgeon?" the indie legend got a polarising reaction of cheers and boos.</p>
<p>He then commented: "She'll pick anyone's pocket, that one."</p>
<p>Seemingly a few fans took issue with this, grabbed their coats and made for the taxi queue. The headlines haven't been kind, either - with the Scottish Sun leading "Morrissey fans storm out of Hydro after the singer blasts First Minister Nicola Sturgeon".</p>
<p>The actual scale of the incident seems to be in question, though. Simply put: was it a rammy or merely a stooshie?</p>
<p>Our man at the show comments: "The stuff about huge walkouts isn't true... perhaps a few people, but that wouldn't be noticeable to the average punter in the crowd".</p>
<p>As for the show itself: "He didn't disappoint... well, maybe at the end with the crap encore!"</p>
<p>A full review will appear on the site tomorrow.</p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 14:31:29 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Robin Murray</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">99872 at http://www.clashmusic.com</guid>
 <comments>http://www.clashmusic.com/live/morrissey-has-ruffled-some-scottish-feathers#comments</comments>
</item>
<item>
 <title>Eastenders Have Been Paying Tribute To Mark E Smith</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/news/eastenders-have-been-paying-tribute-to-mark-e-smith</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Title_Card_Current.jpg?itok=peswNZhj"><a href="/news/eastenders-have-been-paying-tribute-to-mark-e-smith"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Title_Card_Current.jpg?itok=peswNZhj" width="628" height="353" alt="Eastenders" title="Eastenders" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Did you spot it...?</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>The sad passing of The Fall's <strong>Mark E. Smith</strong> has brought all manner of tributes.</p>
<p>Leaving behind a powerful body of work, it was perhaps expected that the music world would pause to remember the iconoclastic frontman.</p>
<p>But we didn't quite expect Eastenders to doff their cap towards The Fall frontman, in the most subtle manner possible.</p>
<p>All week the show has been seeding songs by the group into its soundtrack, with viewers spotting the likes of 'Bend Sinister' cut 'Dktr. Faustus' playing in the background.</p>
<p>In one scene you can even heard The Fall's version of 'Victoria' playing in (where else?) the Queen Vic.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
	<p dir="ltr" lang="en" xml:lang="en">Nice touch for Eastenders to have The Fall playing in The Vic last night!! <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/MarkESmith?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#MarkESmith</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/TheFall?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#TheFall</a></p>
	— Orla Hannon (@redOrly) <a href="https://twitter.com/redOrly/status/963422401391448064?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 13, 2018</a></blockquote>
<script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>It's a nice touch, we have to admit. Get caught up on Eastenders <u><strong><a href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b09s36qt/eastenders-15022018">HERE.</a></strong></u></p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2FJkUVY7e6Q" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 20:24:32 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Robin Murray</dc:creator>

</item>
<item>
 <title>Premiere: Healthy Bones - 'Take It From Me'</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/news/premiere-healthy-bones-take-it-from-me</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/BW2JPEG.jpg?itok=bOI61J2Y"><a href="/news/premiere-healthy-bones-take-it-from-me"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/BW2JPEG.jpg?itok=bOI61J2Y" width="628" height="419" alt="Healthy Bones" title="Healthy Bones" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Taking it back to the roots...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Healthy Bones</strong> have never been hugely addicted to technology.</p>
<p>Sure, it can offer much, but these advances have also stripped away core skills, making us more and more reliant on machinery.</p>
<p>As a result, the band want to strip things back, to go organic and use instruments, and their own will-power, instead of technology.</p>
<p>New single 'Take It From Me' is as real as they come, a determined step back from the edge that feels progressive, not nostalgic.</p>
<p>The band's founder explains...</p>
<p>“It is a slight 'reaction' to what I believe is the overuse of technology out of laziness and not for the benefit of the music, which I think is becoming more common. Creative use of technology can help push boundaries and create amazing soundscapes which I am a huge fan of, but I think a lot of current music lacks personality and a human element.“</p>
<p>Tune in now.</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay" frameborder="no" height="300" scrolling="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=https%3A//api.soundcloud.com/tracks/400462227%3Fsecret_token%3Ds-lqZFx&amp;color=%23ff5500&amp;auto_play=false&amp;hide_related=false&amp;show_comments=true&amp;show_user=true&amp;show_reposts=false&amp;show_teaser=true&amp;visual=true" width="100%"></iframe></p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:48:00 +0000</pubDate>

<item>
 <title>Drake Gave Away Almost $1,000,000 To Make His New Video</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/videos/drake-gave-away-almost-1000000-to-make-his-new-video</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Screen%20shot%202018-02-16%20at%2017.29.44.png?itok=LUV9gvm2"><a href="/videos/drake-gave-away-almost-1000000-to-make-his-new-video"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Screen%20shot%202018-02-16%20at%2017.29.44.png?itok=LUV9gvm2" width="628" height="339" alt="&#039;God&#039;s Plan&#039;" title="&#039;God&#039;s Plan&#039;" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">&quot;Don&#039;t tell the label...&quot;</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Drake</strong> has shared his incredibly charitable new video 'God's Plan'.</p>
<p>The Toronto rapper has been busy in recent weeks, conducting a good will spree and giving money away at every opportunity.</p>
<p>A camera crew followed him on his adventures, with the results used in the video for 'God's Plan'.</p>
<p>Drake labels the video "The most important thing I have ever done in my career..." while the clip opens:</p>
<p>"The budget for this video was $996,631.90. We gave it all away. Don’t tell the label."</p>
<p>Tune in now.</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XUqRem0W8L8" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:35:00 +0000</pubDate>

<item>
 <title>Clash DJ Mix - Jus Now</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/features/clash-dj-mix-jus-now</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Jus_Now_credit_Arnaldo_James_sskgfh.jpg?itok=3SdqAXtf"><a href="/features/clash-dj-mix-jus-now"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Jus_Now_credit_Arnaldo_James_sskgfh.jpg?itok=3SdqAXtf" width="628" height="327" alt="Jus Now (Credit: Arnaldo James)" title="Jus Now (Credit: Arnaldo James)" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">It&#039;s a fiery club-focussed selection from the sought after duo...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Bristol-meets-Trinidad duo <strong>Jus Now</strong> know how to rock the dance.</p>
<p>Steeped in the cousin sounds of soca and dancehall, the production pairing have a larger-than-life sound that comes soaked in tropical colour.</p>
<p>Adding that UK grit to the mixture, Jus Now have stormed across the globe, with their sound proving irresistible to anyone who crosses their path.</p>
<p>Team up with Dismantle for new single ‘Fire (Spotie)', the team invited Busy Signal into the studio for some added fire.</p>
<p>The results are an absolute club stomper, with Jus Now shooting the lavish video in the party hub that is New Orleans.</p>
<p>To keep the energy flowing Jus Now have crafted a new DJ mix for Clash, composed in the studio and featuring some absolute club weapons.</p>
<p>Serious fire from the off, you can expect some potent dancehall, scorching soca, and more than a few exclusives.</p>
<p>Jus Now's Sam comments... “I kept this mix pretty club focussed, 125-130bpm percussive rollers!! There is so much good stuff around that tempo at the moment, I often play most of my sets around that area these days. There are a few exclusives in there, lots of stuff from my label More Time. Hope you enjoy!”</p>
<p>Tune in now.</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay" frameborder="no" height="300" scrolling="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=https%3A//api.soundcloud.com/tracks/400618452&amp;color=%23ff5500&amp;auto_play=false&amp;hide_related=false&amp;show_comments=true&amp;show_user=true&amp;show_reposts=false&amp;show_teaser=true&amp;visual=true" width="100%"></iframe></p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>
 <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:20:15 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Robin Murray</dc:creator>

</item>
<item>
 <title>Premiere: Human Pet - 'Linda Pinky'</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/news/premiere-human-pet-linda-pinky</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Press%20Photo_0.jpg?itok=8QDKDX9j"><a href="/news/premiere-human-pet-linda-pinky"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Press%20Photo_0.jpg?itok=8QDKDX9j" width="628" height="444" alt="Human Pet" title="Human Pet" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fuzzed out songwriting with an ice cool vibe...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Human Pet</strong> are crawling out of London's vital DIY underground, a network of promoters, tape labels, rehearsal spaces, and studios.</p>
<p>Having made their name with a feral, vital live show - a recent set at a Fluffer Pit Party testifies to this - the band have also spent time fine-tuning their songwriting.</p>
<p>Fuzzed out and ice cold, Human Pet's scratchy indie sound is layered in grunge effects, with more than one Big Muff laying down their life for the cause.</p>
<p>With a flurry of live shows planned, Human Pet have linked with Permanent Creeps for new single 'Linda Pinky'.</p>
<p>Strikingly surreal songwriting, the off kilter riffing burrows its way into your cranium, while the stripped back production is as raw as they come.</p>
<p>Tune in now.</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay" frameborder="no" height="300" scrolling="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=https%3A//api.soundcloud.com/tracks/387424103&amp;color=%23ff5500&amp;auto_play=false&amp;hide_related=false&amp;show_comments=true&amp;show_user=true&amp;show_reposts=false&amp;show_teaser=true&amp;visual=true" width="100%"></iframe></p>
<p>Catch Human Pet at the following shows:</p>
<p><strong>February</strong><br />
	17 <strong>London</strong> Secret warehouse party release show</p>
<p><strong>March</strong><br />
	3 <strong>London</strong> The Old Blue Last Supporting LUMER (Permanent Creeps Club)<br />
	10 <strong>London</strong> Hairy &amp; SIR All Dayer w/ Black Doldrums/Melt Dunes/Long Teeth<br />
	25 <strong>London</strong> Night Terrors All-Dayer</p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>

typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/IMG_6556.JPG?itok=rFS4YIUg" width="628" height="419" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/IMG_6566.JPG?itok=P30-i3R8" width="600" height="900" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/IMG_6571.JPG?itok=QyIALMNu"><a href="/features/in-conversation-marlon-williams"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/IMG_6571.JPG?itok=QyIALMNu" width="600" height="900" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" title="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" /></a></div><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0031.jpg?itok=hWMjubws"><a href="/features/in-conversation-marlon-williams"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0031.jpg?itok=hWMjubws" width="600" height="900" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" title="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" /></a></div><div class="field-item odd" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0034.jpg?itok=9prSQFpu"><a href="/features/in-conversation-marlon-williams"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0034.jpg?itok=9prSQFpu" width="600" height="900" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" title="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" /></a></div><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0035.jpg?itok=ExU6e95G"><a href="/features/in-conversation-marlon-williams"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/img0035.jpg?itok=ExU6e95G" width="628" height="942" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" title="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" /></a></div><div class="field-item odd" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Screen%20shot%202018-02-16%20at%2015.51.23.jpg?itok=366V57OK"><a href="/features/in-conversation-marlon-williams"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/Screen%20shot%202018-02-16%20at%2015.51.23.jpg?itok=366V57OK" width="628" height="835" alt="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" title="Marlon Williams (Credit: Holly Whitaker)" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">The heartbreak that drives the songwriter&#039;s enthralling new album...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Life on the road can be a continual act of self-sacrifice. It’s inspiring, sure – why else would musicians do it, after all? - but it also involves placing your life on hold, putting things dear to you in stasis, an emotional hold-all that you simply place in a locker, and hope it’s still there when you return.</p>
<p><strong>Marlon Williams</strong> spent almost two years on the road, following his self-titled full length as it gained an international audience. Along the way he met another songwriter – the remarkable Aldous Harding – and the two fell for each other, a relationship conducted via small snapshots of time, slender meetings, prolonged phone calls, texts, and Skype conversation.</p>
<p>But it didn’t last. Maybe it couldn’t. From this experience, though, grew Marlon Williams’ new album ‘Make Way For Love’ - it’s a break up record, or sorts, but to use this fairly hackneyed term ignores it’s questions about art, touring, loneliness, and the simple desire to make a real, true connection with someone.</p>
<p>“I needed to make this album,” he admits. “I’ve never needed to make an album before, I’ve always made albums because I like making music, but this time around there was a necessity to it. That was a new feeling for me. And it was intense. More of a crime of passion, I suppose, than anything I’ve ever done.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tAr1pbeX4RE" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>Not that it came easy. Detoxing from lengthy spells on the road, Marlon found that the muse wasn’t about to return without a fight. “I hadn’t finished a song in two years,” he recalls. “And then in a matter of three and a half weeks I came out with 15 or so. It really felt like I came out the other end with blood on my hands, and I couldn’t remember anything that had happened.”</p>
<p>Returning to his native Lyttleton – a small town on New Zealand’s south island – he worked quickly, desperate to get his thoughts down in one place. “I always plan to do pre-production in Lyttleton, and then fly to the States to record the album,” he says. “But it just all sort of lined up in a way that made sense. There’s a few songs that were conceived before the break up, but it’s definitely a therapeutic process for me.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<blockquote>
	<p>If it starts getting too easy then you’ve got to wonder about what you’re doing.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>Able to work with close friends, Marlon called up the Yarra Benders, his confidantes and contemporaries for some time now. The actual process of writing a full album, however, remains stubbornly difficult – Clash asks, does it ever get easier with time?</p>
<p>“Well, it does and it doesn’t,” he admits with a sigh. “And in a way, it shouldn’t. If it starts getting too easy then you’ve got to wonder about what you’re doing. But there are certain practical things that you learn from doing it repeatedly, and just knowing the things that really piss you off during the album making process is a really important thing to learn, I think. All the basic things.”</p>
<p>“In terms of approaching the process you’ve got to give it the same amount of energy and tackle it with the same vigour as you did the last time round.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<blockquote>
	<p>The break up was definitely a catalyst...</p>
</blockquote>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>‘Make Way For Love’ certainly doesn’t lack vigour. The vocal performances are some of the truest, most honest, Marlon has ever recorded, shifting from the passion of ‘Come To Me’ to the sheer exhausted regret of ‘Nobody Gets What They Want Anymore’. It could well stem from the material itself, that sense of carefully packed away emotions suddenly being unleashed.</p>
<p>“The break up was definitely a catalyst,” he admits. “And just generally a whole bunch of built up tension inside me, because after a couple of years of solid touring and a lot of uncertainty on all fronts I definitely feel like I sometimes need something to open the floodgates. But I’ve never had that as a writer before, so it was a new experience.”</p>
<p>Not that this impacted on his actual artistry, with the methodology remaining strikingly familiar. “I tend to write songs fully formed,” he says. “All the demos have pretty much the same arrangements. There were a couple of songs that I wrote on piano and had no idea where they were gonna go until we got into the studio, but for the most part… For me, it’s like listening to the radio, and then you Shazam the song and find out how the rest of it goes. I don’t write in a constructive, linear fashion… it all just happens at once.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p><img alt="" src="http://admin.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/field/image/IMG_6556.JPG" style="width: 1200px; height: 800px;" /></p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>Collecting his material, Marlon Williams – plus his ever-reliant Yarra Benders – flew out to the United States, working with producer Noah Georgeson on some quickfire sessions. “We only had 10 days in the studio and we had a lot of sonic ground to cover,” he says. “We were working pretty quickly. It was a fast-paced process. I’d like to make an album where I’ve got a fair bit more time, and feel free to try a few different things but there’s benefits to working quickly too.”</p>
<p>Despite the personal nature of the material the studio remained a relatively loose environment, with Marlon able to work out his issues amongst some of the people closest to him. “I’ve known my band for a long, long time,” he says, “so it’s not like I’m presenting it to strangers and expecting them to just look straight ahead and move with it. They know me and know what haunts me.”</p>
<p>It’s remarkable, then, given the explosion of emotion that ‘Make Way For Love’ is such a succinct, cohesive experience. “It was a very unconscious thing,” he admits. “Like I said, I came out the other side and was just astonished. By the fact I was doing it in such a short amount of time, that there’s got to be some sort of unity to these songs; they were coming from the same place and it all felt like part of the same journey for me. There’s definitely a huge amount of faith into acting out this cyclical piece.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<blockquote>
	<p>We were working pretty quickly. It was a fast-paced process.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>Opening track ‘Come To Me’ was penned in Glasgow, and represents “a naive optimism and an excitement about the challenge”, a naivety that was soon dispelled. The debauched ‘Party Boy’ represents the dangers of becoming seduced by rock ‘n’ roll life, by the pleasures of the road. “That’s a composite of being at a whole bunch of different social events,” he recalls. “The more parties you go to the more you get a feel for the characters that make up the play. There’s always that guy who is everyone’s friend but no one quite trusts them.”</p>
<p>Throughout the whole album, though, is the hidden figure of Aldous Harding. Bringing the cycle to a close, Marlon invited her to sing on ‘Nobody Gets What They Want Any More’ - she accepted, but due to timing issues was forced to perform her lines across a phone line.</p>
<p>“She was in Cardiff, in Wales, and I was in Portland,” he says. “I had recorded the album a month earlier, so I had done my parts. It was kind of weird but kind of poignant, and fitting. We were very used to being on the phone. It was very layered. It was good – I would rather it had been in the studio, to do it that way, but it was kind of nice.”</p>
<p>“Her performance is more guttural than she normally does. She was feeling it, I guess.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<blockquote>
	<p>It was kind of weird but kind of poignant, and fitting.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>- - -</p>
<p>Did he need this album, in some way, to understand the past two years?</p>
<p>“I feel like it’s a self-perpetuating thing,” he explains. “You see a lot of artists, and people just generally, who constantly require the push and pull of that stuff to really… They force the issue sometimes.”</p>
<p>“I think it’s something that’s just innate in human nature,” he insists, “but it was really interesting to watch myself do that, and to feel like it was like on another side, that I could listen to the songs back and learn something for myself.”</p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WsJIDptF-2c" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p>- - -</p>
<p><em>'Make Way For Love' is out now.</em></p>
<p>Words: <strong>Robin Murray</strong><br />
	Photography: <strong>Holly Whitaker</strong></p>

Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
<p><u style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32); line-height: 20px; font-family: 'Droid Serif', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; font-size: 14px;"><strong><a href="http://clashmagazine.tictail.com/" style="color: rgb(35, 31, 32);"><u><strong>B</strong></u>uy Clash Magazine</a></strong></u></p>
</div></div></div></description>

</item>
<item>
 <title>Aidan Moffat & RM Hubbert Are Working On A New Album</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/news/aidan-moffat-rm-hubbert-are-working-on-a-new-album</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/lpierrebestWEB_2.jpeg?itok=EhKtnq6b"><a href="/news/aidan-moffat-rm-hubbert-are-working-on-a-new-album"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/lpierrebestWEB_2.jpeg?itok=EhKtnq6b" width="608" height="456" alt="Aidan Moffat" title="Aidan Moffat" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">&#039;Here Lies The Body&#039; is incoming on Rock Action...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Aidan Moffat</strong> and <strong>RM Hubbert</strong> are working on a full collaborative album.</p>
<p>The songwriters have known each other for some time, and have released music together in the past.</p>
<p>This will be the first time, however, that the pair have worked on something substantial, resulting in new full length project 'Here Lies The Body'.</p>
<p>Incoming on Rock Action Records, it's lead by this neat, surreal, eye-catching clip 'Zoltar'...</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
	<p dir="ltr" lang="en" xml:lang="en">Here Lies The Body.<br />
		The debut album by Aidan Moffat &amp; RM Hubbert.<br />
		Coming soon on <a href="https://twitter.com/rockactionrecs?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@rockactionrecs</a>.<br /><br />
		(Zoltar footage courtesy of <a href="https://twitter.com/mesmoland?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@mesmoland</a>) <a href="https://t.co/9DWSoT9KHb">pic.twitter.com/9DWSoT9KHb</a></p>
	— RM Hubbert (@rmhubbert) <a href="https://twitter.com/rmhubbert/status/964500261560569857?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2018</a></blockquote>
<script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MuWnFHvFJN0" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p>Related: <u><strong><a href="http://www.clashmusic.com/features/farewell-pierre-catching-up-with-aidan-moffat">Farewell, Pierre - Catching Up With Aidan Moffat</a></strong></u></p>

<item>
 <title>Ride Look Back In 'Catch You Dreaming' Video</title>
 <link>http://www.clashmusic.com/videos/ride-look-back-in-catch-you-dreaming-video</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-field-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" rel="og:image rdfs:seeAlso" resource="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/unnamed%281%29_251.jpg?itok=QdtjR3Fq"><a href="/videos/ride-look-back-in-catch-you-dreaming-video"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="http://www.clashmusic.com/sites/default/files/styles/article_feature/public/field/image/unnamed%281%29_251.jpg?itok=QdtjR3Fq" width="628" height="974" alt="Ride" title="Ride" /></a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-subtitle field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">It&#039;s a reflective new clip from the shoegaze group...</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><strong>Ride</strong> have shared the reflective new video for 'Catch You Dreaming'.</p>
<p>One of the finest aspects of the shoegaze band's return is how natural it feels, with Ride slipping back into the more creative aspects of their identity.</p>
<p>New EP ‘Tomorrow’s Shore’ was released earlier today, a four track offering that ably builds on comeback album 'Weather Diaries'.</p>
<p>'Catch You Dreaming' is Ride at their most wistful, and the new video reflects this by casting the band's memories back to their original incarnation.</p>
<p>Old photographs are exhumed, but what rings through most is the unity that currently guides them.</p>
<p>‘Catch You Dreaming’ Director Niall Trask says: “For me the song evoked feelings of human memory, time and travel. So it seemed natural to capture it visually with collage. We incorporated the wave element so familiar in Ride’s art direction, their foundations in Banbury, the energy of a live show, all bound together with a performance scenario."</p>
<p>Tune in now.</p>
<p><iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nwKiOwz3hsU" width="560"></iframe></p>
<p>Ride play London's ULU tonight (February 16th).</p>
<p><em>Join us on <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Vero</strong></u></a>, as we get under the skin of global cultural happenings. Follow <a href="https://getvero.app.link/R6I0B0Qj6B"><u><strong>Clash Magazine</strong></u></a> as we skip merrily between clubs, concerts, interviews and photo shoots. Get backstage sneak peeks and a true view into our world as the fun and games unfold.</em></p>
